image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason looks off camera.

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason has been on leave with pay for almost a year while he faced allegations of family violence, but the Tasmanian government appears to have no mechanism to suspend or remove him, even after his guilty verdict.Â

title.children: Judge guilty of causing concussion and bruising to a woman, but will remain on a $500,000 salary

image.altText: Gregory Geason on mobile phone outside court.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian Supreme Court judge is found guilty of one charge each of assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge found guilty of assault

image.altText: A former student stares down the barrel of the camera with a serious expression. She is sitting on an orange couch.

props.synopsis: Young people allege verbal and physical assault at Tasmanian schools as bullying inquiry gets underway.Â

title.children: 'Broad daylight hate crime': Allegations of assault on LGBTQIA+ students in Tasmanian schools

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: Hobart's status as the gateway to Antarctica has been secured after the federal government agreed to fund a new home port for Australia's icebreaker, but the Tasmanian government will be on the hook for the cost of a refuelling solution â€” something which has been a problem of late.

title.children: Port funding announced to secure Hobart as 'gateway to Antarctica'

image.altText: A faded car sticker that reads King Island: Think Buy Live Local

props.synopsis: Despite a high price tag, the Tasmanian Freight Equalisation Scheme is just not working the way it should.

title.children: This costly scheme helps small businesses, so why has almost no one on King Island got a good thing to say about it?

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Foreign Minister said she didn't believe "we gain anything by shouting each other down" after being forced to stop her speech multiple times.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protesters shout down Penny Wong as she delivers speech in Tasmania

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new ferry wharf

props.synopsis: A trial passenger service between Hobart and Bellerive has proven so successful that a permanent ferry terminal is being proposed.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Indoor waiting area, bicycle storage part of newly released designs for upgraded Bellerive ferry wharf

image.altText: Photos of a bus station.

props.synopsis: A mayor and Tasmanian government department are at odds over how a bus interchange could be "ticked off" despite not being fit-for-purpose, with the corner too tight for buses to turn.

title.children: Million-dollar bus interchange sitting unused 10 months later after being built too tight for buses to turn

image.altText: Guy BarnettÂ stands in front of a big painting and smiles.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a new deputy premier, as an early morning meeting of the Liberal Party elects minister Guy Barnett to the role in the wake of Michael Ferguson's departure from the cabinet for the backbench.

title.children: Guy Barnett elected unopposed as Tasmania's deputy premier

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing at night, with shades of blue and green, over green pastures

props.synopsis: A spell of wild weather is on the cards for everywhere from Queensland to Tasmania, with thunderstorms forecast to sweep across Australia's east over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Wild weather predicted across Australia's south-east over next 48 hours

image.altText: M1A1 Abrams tank

props.synopsis: The announcement was welcomed by Ukraine's ambassador to Australia, Vasyl Myroshnychenko.Â

title.children: Ukraine to receive aging Abrams tanks in latest Australian military aid package

image.altText: A local resident and a rescuer stand on debris of a building.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president tells politicians his plan contains five main points that rely on Kyiv's allies, including an unconditional invitation to join NATO and specific weapons support.

title.children: Zelenskyy unveils victory plan as Russia reports capture of two Ukrainian villages

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench looking at a photograph. The faces in the photo are blurred.

props.synopsis: A mother whose son suffered repeated sexual abuse as a child was shocked to find his abuser exhibiting at the Perth Royal Show â€” now she's demanding changes to stop offenders working at shows around the country.

title.children: This mother was horrified to spot her son's abuser working at the Perth Royal Show, where background checks aren't required

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: Eight years ago, in what now seems like an act of reckless naivety, I bought my brother a 23andMe at-home DNA-test birthday present. Now the struggling company may sell its treasure trove of genetic data.

title.children: Eight years ago, my brother gave his DNA to 23andMe. We can't take it back â€” and it may soon get sold

image.altText: A grey and white little fluffy Greater gliders on a gum tree  branch looking ahead with big round eyes and a long fluffy tail.

props.synopsis: Logging is set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders have been sighted, despite conservationists warning the government regulator of their presence.Â

title.children: Surveys find three times the number of endangered gliders present than what loggers claim

image.altText: Liam Hooper sits at a cafe table on a city street.

props.synopsis: Staring at a third recession in just two years, Kiwis are moving across the ditch to Australia in substantial numbers, seeking a sunnier economic climate.

title.children: New Zealand's economic woes lure thousands of Kiwis to Australia

image.altText: a pregnant woman lying on a couch holding her belly

props.synopsis: South Australia's upper house has narrowly voted down a proposal to amend abortion laws so that people who want to terminate their pregnancy after 28 weeks would be required to deliver their baby alive.Â

title.children: Late-term abortion bill defeated in SA's upper house

image.altText: A ni-Vanuatu man poses with his daughter, who is wearing a bright pink dress

props.synopsis: A former striker for Vanuatu's national youth soccer team drowned in a dam while on the job in Australia. He's one of at least 84 Pacific seasonal workers who have died here since 2020.

title.children: At least 84 Pacific seasonal workers have died in four years. Their families are often left empty-handed

image.altText: An older man with a vibrant shirt sits by a kitchen bench with a sullen look on his face, holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Clients of Netstrata have told the ABC the strata firm has begun uploading years of invoices, with brokerage fees up to six times industry standard.

title.children: Apartment owners are noticing mysterious invoices appear in their portals. What they reveal is shocking

image.altText: Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, wave farewell before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: King Charles is heading to Australia for his first royal visit since becoming king. Here's where you might catch a glimpse of royalty.Â

title.children: Here's where you can catch a glimpse of Charles and Camilla in Australia

image.altText: Two men in suits waving to the crowd.

props.synopsis: In a Queensland election debate devoid of big moments, both leaders tried to wedge each other on familiar ground.Â

title.children: Miles and Crisafulli used their debate to drive home messages but didn't deviate far from the script

image.altText: A young woman with dark brown hair smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: Easing the cost of living and making it more attainable for young people to buy a house will be the deciding factors for some young voters on October 26.Â

title.children: A vision for the future over 'cash splashes': The deciding factors for young voters ahead of the Queensland election

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: The national birth rate has hit a record low and is now at a critical level, with economic consequences for the future.

title.children: As Australia's fertility rate hits rock bottom have we hit the point of no return?

image.altText: Mackenzie Eardley hugs teammates

props.synopsis: Hawthorn has gone from being a team unable to make use of the ball to one of the AFLW's most exciting teams. Here's how the Hawks did it.

title.children: How the Hawks learned to score

image.altText: Sue wears a bright red shirt and matching red rimmed glasses, she smiles widely at the camera from behind her desk.

props.synopsis: Sue Wright has been recognised for her significant contribution to Australia's transport industry, but as a woman in a male-dominated field she has overcome plenty of prejudice in the spare parts world.

title.children: This road transport hall of famer has been setting truckies straight for more than 50 years

image.altText: a female snorkeller taking a photo of a turtle underwater

props.synopsis: The artificial intelligence used for passport facial scanning is now helping Australian conservationists track elusive sea turtles.

title.children: Conservationists keep tabs on sea turtles with the same face scanning tech used in airports

image.altText: Dozens of people put their hands in the air at a concert.

props.synopsis: Hidden fees and practices like dynamic pricing â€” which sees ticket prices go up as an event becomes more popular â€” have outraged consumers.

title.children: Concert ticket dynamic pricing, hotel and gym hidden fees, face government ban

image.altText: A cloud of grey dusty smoke rises in the middle of a tightly packed city of apartments

props.synopsis: A barrage of Israeli air strikes hit towns across southern Lebanon and Beirut's southern suburbs. Meanwhile, the Israeli prime minister dismisses calls for a ceasefire.Â

title.children: Mayor of Lebanese town killed in Israeli strikes as Netanyahu rejects calls for ceasefire

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Geelong Waterfront.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the alleged theft of possibly more than $100,000 from G21 Geelong Region Alliance. The advocacy group is primarily funded by five local councils between Geelong and Colac Otway Shire.

title.children: 'This is ratepayer money': Police probe years-long theft from major advocacy group

image.altText: What appears to be the feet of a male, following someone in high heels in a dark environment with shadows.

props.synopsis: A Personal Safety Survey, released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, has found an estimated 2.7 million Australians have been stalked, with women more likely to be followed by a man they know.

title.children: One in five Australian women have been stalked, according to new data

image.altText: a man with a beard in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Former Labor minister Ian Macdonald has alleged a "miscarriage of justice" in an appeal against his prison sentence for corruptly awarding a mining licence in the NSW Hunter Valley.Â

title.children: Ex-NSW minister appeals 14-year jail term for corruptly awarding mine licence

image.altText: A teenage boy's hands on a table. He is fidgeting, wrapping fingers around his thumb.

props.synopsis: The boy, who was incarcerated in Perth's Banksia Hill Detention Centre and faced 36 criminal charges, has been released from custody without further penalties. A magistrate described him as WA's "most vulnerable child".

title.children: 'State's most vulnerable child': 11yo WA boy released after a total 77 days in custody

image.altText: A seawall damaged in a storm.

props.synopsis: Roads and beaches on the tropical Cocos (Keeling) Islands in the Indian Ocean remain shut, but a rising tide and further high swells have officials worried that the worst is yet to come.

title.children: 'Absolute freak' swells topple seawalls, bury beaches on Australia's most remote territory

image.altText: Two oval containers with white pouches and golden pouches on a background of yellow and orange graphic.

props.synopsis: Teens say an illegal nicotine product is easy to procure, leaving experts calling for better enforcement.

title.children: Nicotine pouches are illegal in Australia, so how are young people getting hold of them?

image.altText: Dozens of army recruits in green uniforms crowd around a desk where some people are signing white forms

props.synopsis: State media claims more than a million people have signed up to North Korea's army, as tensions continue to simmer between Pyongyang and South Korea.

title.children: 'Wiped off the map': North Korea claims more than a million new recruits have signed up to its army amid tensions with South Korea
